intro: Oxytropis yezoensis, commonly known as Yezo milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of eastern Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its upright growth habit and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellow or white flowers that bloom in early summer, attracting various pollinators. It is adapted to grow in well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine environments. Oxytropis yezoensis is also valued for its ability to fix nitrogen, contributing to soil fertility in its native habitats.
